meanings.definition: The quality of being severe or strict in manner or attitude.
meanings.sent1: Her austerities in the classroom made her students behave well.
meanings.sent2: The monk's austerities were evident in his simple way of living.
meanings.sent3: The austerities of the strict librarian made the children whisper in fear.
meanings.sent4: His austerities towards punctuality were unmatched in the office.
meanings.sent5: The austerities of the judge were known throughout the town for their fairness.

meanings.definition: Difficult economic conditions resulting from government policy.
meanings.sent1: The country faced austerities after the new tax laws were implemented.
meanings.sent2: During the recession, many families experienced austerities.
meanings.sent3: The austerities caused by the budget cuts affected the entire community.
meanings.sent4: The austerities brought about by the financial crisis were challenging for small businesses.
meanings.sent5: The government's austerities led to widespread protests across the nation.
